title: How is backmasking done in music? - Quora

response.answer_text: We used to do your regular tracks first,then turn the tape around and record what you want to be backwards.You can also record sounds like that and develop very textured,interesting soundscapes.I also believe a certain spiritual element is involved with the stuff that isn't recorded on purpose.When you record the same words backwards,they don't come out like they do in the recordings from the artist.Try it out. JAK

This is pretty simple. You record several tracks of audio. Then you choose 1 of the tracks in your sequencer, and apply a Reverse plug-in to it. In the old days before digital this was done by playing a tape recorder backwards.
